<<<api>>>: SortedMap.firstKey
<<<code>>>:  List<Integer> list = new ArrayList<>();
list.add(20);
list.add(3);
list.add(6);
int maxIndex = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < list.size(); i++) {
if (list.get(i) > list.get(maxIndex)) {
maxIndex = i;
}
}
int[] indices = new int[maxIndex];
for (int i = 0; i < maxIndex; i++) {
indices[i] = i;
}
System.out.println("Indices: " + Arrays.toString(indices));

<<<explanation>>>: In the above code, we first add some elements to a List. Then we iterate through the list and compare each element with the current maximum element. If we find a larger element, we update the maxIndex variable. Finally, we create an array of indices containing the indices of the maximum elements and print it out.
